speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about these black spots you're seeing in your right eye? Are they constant or do they come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: They've been there for about 2 days now, and they seem to appear and disappear on their own. I was reading a book last night and I saw one, then I looked again and it was gone.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the size of these black spots - are they small, medium, or quite large?

speaker: Patient
text: They're actually quite small, no bigger than a pinhead. They're just tiny dots that appear and disappear, and they seem to be scattered randomly around my vision.

speaker: Doctor
text: How long have you been experiencing these black spots, and have you noticed any pattern or consistency to their appearance, such as appearing more frequently after certain activities or at specific times of the day?

speaker: Patient
text: It started about 2 days ago, and I have to admit, I'm not sure if it's just the book I was reading, but it seems like they're more noticeable when I'm reading or concentrating on something.

speaker: Doctor
text:
I'd like to perform a quick visual examination of your eye to get a better look at these black spots. Can you please look up and then down for me, and I'll take a closer look?



Please, also, can you tell me when you first noticed these black spots in your eye, and if you've experienced any eye pain or discomfort?



Also, have you noticed any changes in the color or shape of these black spots over time?

speaker: Patient
text:
I first noticed them last night while I was reading, and to be honest, I didn't think much of it at first, but they've been persistent since then.

I've experienced no eye pain or discomfort, just a slight feeling of being off-balance when I look at them.

As for the color and shape, I'd say they're more of a black dot, but sometimes they seem to flicker or change slightly, like they're moving or shifting.

speaker: Doctor
text:
So you've noticed these black spots in your right eye for about two weeks now, and you've seen them come and go, but more frequently at night. Can you tell me, have you recently traveled or been exposed to anyone who has a history of HIV or AIDS?



Also, I'd like to examine your eyelids for any signs of swelling or redness. Please gently lift your top eyelid for me.

speaker: Patient
text:
No, I haven't recently traveled or been exposed to anyone with a history of HIV or AIDS, I just try to stay isolated as much as possible since I was diagnosed with Kaposi's sarcoma.

And yeah, my eyelids look normal, I don't see any swelling or redness.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about the activities you've been doing since you started noticing these black spots? Have you changed your job, taken up any new hobbies, or been engaging in any strenuous physical activities that might be putting stress on your eyes?



Also, I'd like to take a closer look at your eyelids again. Are there any other areas of redness or swelling that I should be aware of?



Please, look straight ahead and I'll gently press on the sclera of your eye to check for any areas of tenderness or pain.
